data.title: I Can’t Stop Thinking About This Scene From ‘Soylent Green’
data.meta_description: Soylent Green is probably best known as a punchline. In 1993, Phil Hartman parodied the movie on Saturday Night Live, although he was making fun of Soylent Green’s growling manly man star, Charlton…
data.text:
Soylent Green is probably best known as a punchline. In 1993, Phil Hartman parodied the movie on Saturday Night Live, although he was making fun of Soylent Green’s growling manly man star, Charlton Heston, more than he was the actual movie.

Spoiler Alert: I do hate writing a spoiler alert for a movie that came out in 1973 but if you haven’t seen ‘Soylent Green,’ go rent it now. It’s good.

In the sketch, Hartman’s Heston shouts the film’s stunning final line which is “Soylent Green is people!” It was hilarious at the time and it still is, although both Hartman and Heston have faded from the pop-culture consciousness. Hartman was one of the most talented comedic actors SNL ever produced and Heston is still recognizable as Moses and as the only living man in Planet of the Apes. That is a classic but Soylent Green is Heston’s best post-apocalyptic movie (he made more than two.)

The dramatic line ‘Soylent Green is people’ refers to Heston’s futuristic cop character’s discovery that New York City is being fed free crackers secretly made from the dead. Soylent Green is a sci-fi drama that…
